intro: Euphrasia saamica, commonly known as the Saami eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, moist habitats such as tundra and rocky slopes. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in early summer, and it has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Euphrasia saamica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
